subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] CW Program for morse code
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Steve,

the CW decoder gets mainly the letters E, I and T.
I also noticed that the beeps are all the same length in your file.

So I made a raw audio file for EVPmaker that contains three cues: The
"dit" and "dah" beeps, and an "intra-character gap":

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/Stefan/Morse%20code/morse.wav

The "Use Cue List" option must be checked in EVPmaker to use this file.

Now it sounds a bit more like actual morse code, and CwGet is able to
decode more letters. Perhaps some former ham operators "over there" are
able to use it... :)

Stefan

-- 


> Here's the program if anybody wants to play around with it.  It also 
> picks up stuff without playing the file through evpmaker and converts 
> it into letters just by using the microphone on the computer.  I'm 
> going to try and figure this out later, you can also cancel out 
> certain frequencies too.  It's worth exploring into this a bit.  For 
> those who don't get what i'm trying to do, i'm running my frequency 
> file through evpmaker and it than sounds like morse code.  Than i'm 
> using a program to try and convert the jumbled morse code sounding 
> file from evpmaker into coherent messages typed on the computer 
> screen.

  
> The program is called Cwget.  I grew up on Ham Radio, so this doesn't 
> sound so far fetched for me.  But sorry if i'm losing some people on 
> this method.

> 73's
> -Steve H.

> p.s.  The program was too large for yahoo, so here's a link:

> http://www.dxsoft.com/micwget.htm



> ------------------------------------

> Yahoo! Groups Links
